content: *marla and sami collection* marla 1 is made from 2 strands of lighter-weight yarn that have been dyed separately and then plied together when worked marla creates a marled fabric where the colors are uniquely distributed sami 2 the semi-solid dk-weight sister to marla has a palette of 11 coordinating colors brioche ribs change color in a swirl around a simple cowl letting one tweedy color of marla share the spotlight with a semi-solid sami the technique is much easier than it looks all it takes is moving a ring marker over a couple stitches every few rounds ||||||| size approximately 23½ circumference x 8 deep materials manos del uruguay sami 100% superwash merino approx 273 yds / 100g 1 skip manos del uruguay marla 100% superwash merino approx 273 yds / 100g 1 skip shown in sami y2612 peonies a with marla k600 twilight b us 4 / 3 5mm 16 circular needle or size to obtain gauge 3 distinct stitch markers tapestry needle gauge 18 sts and 52 rnds = 4 in brioche knitting relaxed notes one skein each of sami and marla provides enough yarn for two cowls at end of round always drop old color at back of work at beginning of round always pick up new color from underneath old color to secure it 1 https //fairmountfibers com/products/marla 2 https //fairmountfibers com/collections/yarns/products/sami
